it has been a long time since i played this but i remember it being a very good typing game with a lovely setting and story i want to try the sequel some day
easy play and nice story line
good

fun typing game nice paper craft type of art style good narration and story i wish i could have changed the keybind since i dont like pressing left shift to run it wont even let me use r shiftt my fingers need to stay on asdf so its a bit awkward to press l shift to run
has a nostalgic armor games type vibe very engaging and even somewhat chill game
really fun i love to type

the most beautiful graphics ever plus word typing gameplay that is so unique like i only know one other game that has similar idea of gameplay yet this one is executed so smoothly great music that fits in and the lore is pretty fascinating too absolutely worth the prize so go play it yall

gotta be honest i didnt see this review coming but the first real boss battle had me giggling like a child i thought hey im pretty great at typing ill breeze through this game only to find out that they start throwing some ridiculous words your way in a very short time frame im not sure but it feels like the faster you type the harder the game gets to compensate  so far i am having a blast with this game which i absolutely didnt expect from a simple typing game
really good although a bit hard to maintain the energy
imaginative and cleverly made epistory draws you into a papercrafted world that unfolds with every keystroke

enjoyable exploration game with some narrative and a lot of typing i did not finish it due to distractions from other games but what bits ive played have been a lot of fun would recommend for people who like a rather chill experience i dont find the typing segments to be very difficult but your mileage may vary

reviewing after 100   the storys a really touching emotional journey the gameplay is decently fun to kill time with and decently challenging in certain segments for the completionists out there some of these achievements are a huge timesink if not using a modded dictionary just do that killing 10000 bugs will give you carpal tunnel
unique combat system delightful art

fantastic game really tells the story through the gameplay and has a natural progression of abilities that you learn as you go  sometimes can be a little hard to figure out the next step if you miss a reveal point or get stuck on a puzzle but for the most part its very intuitive probably one of my favourite games  would recommend
wonderful artwork makes the process of learning or relearning how to type a pleasure and the arena mode provides some serious challenge to those looking for more practice

the game is fun  im using it to get used to the layout of my new keyboard the narration is quite soothing and the game ramps up in difficulty while allowing you to tackle tougher challenges early if you want
fun
i just finished the game and i love it so much  one of a kind
great game if you want to learn to touch type or a new keyboard layout

the world unfolds around you like a beautifully illustrated book with a personal touching story that is slowly revealed as the girl rides her fox through forests and caves full of monster great for most ages great for people learning to master the keyboard great way to get kids to type
i feel like this is the only good typing game period
fantastic game helped me learn to touch type when i was younger
cute game definitely a great motivation for children to learn to type fast
interesting story nice variation on typing games
enjoyable story line and a fun strategy game its semilinear but also kind of open world its an interesting combo definitely try it out
banana
this was such a lovely adventure i love the artwork and atmosphere and i really enjoyed that you had to type to use abilities the story was really interesting as well
despite overstaying its welcome i cannot give thumbs down to the game that depicts mental health through metaphors

if you enjoy typing challenges epistory is  good game its more than just typing words on the screentheres a unique magic system where you must type specific words to unleash different abilities like ice to slow enemies and fire to burn through the next word i wont spoil the rest but i really enjoyed the mechanics the story didnt grab me personally but im glad i came back to finish the game definitely worth a buy
i liked the art style and the storytelling of this typing game it took me about 7 hours to beat this game and would highly recommend

it is a fun adventure typing game and has you fight monsters and explore new areas it is also not only about typing but about finding out what youre supposed to do put it on the adaptive mode and it can get to youre level the first nest is the hardest and it  will get easier as it adapts to youre level i am in fifth grade and i think others my age will like this game

epistory  typing chronicles has a unique idea but the execution didnt really hook me the typing mechanic is neat at first but after a while it starts feeling repetitive rather than engaging the story is forgettable and the world while pretty feels kind of empty its not a bad game but once the novelty of typing wears off theres not much left to keep you invested

epistory is a great game that transcends the typing mechanic the story is great the graphics are beautiful and remind me of tearaway on the vita with an hd twist i love all of epistory and recommend it highly

this is a truly special game it seamlessly blends typing mechanics with exploration combat and puzzlesolving in an origamiinspired world the story about a writer overcoming writers block and a girl on a fox exploring unfolds beautifully as you play
love this game i feel like my typing is getting better and it is so functional
best typing game on steam
creative and engrossing

epistory is a game about running around in a paper world and defeating enemies and puzzles by typing words out if you do not like typing this game isnt for you  however beyond that it tells a cute story and i enjoyed my time with it doesnt overstay its welcome and the mystery of deciphering whats going on keeps you engaged until the end hits  i had a great time with it
great game it is alot more challenging than i was expecting
very relaxing and casual
really fun game about typing if that is what you like i can recommend it wholeheartedly
beautiful  a very nice game where skill is related to  typing
great game

pretty straightforward concept for a game however this game is beautiful and really fun its also the right level of challenging for me and i love trying to beat my typing speed stats highly recommend for anyone interested in typing games and something that you can pick up and jump right into
its alright got this in a bundle  theres a demo if youre on the fence if you think itll make you a better typist probably not  if you like typing being part of your game experience this is alright
came for the typing practice on my new mechanical keyboard stayed for the story a classic indie gutpunch at the end highly recommend
very good
charming unusual control scheme appropriate challenge level
very useful game to gamify typing practice it is forgiving but adjusts to the needs of the typist

immensely fun game with simple combat idea typing words to shoot my poor typing habits are deeply ingrained at this point 25 wpm rip but it is definitely still very playable even if you technically suck
thank you

liked the art and story while some words rotated they used many new and when a monster had a big word there werent very many of them my typing was already pretty good but definitely think it improved though i made many typos and while im happy there wasnt a penalty for that due to the speed of the monsters no penalty definitely didnt improve my typo making overall would recommend and not only for those that want to improve their typing speed
it makes typing fun but doesnt teach sentences

i wanted a typing game and this delivered gameplay is fun and difficulty increases at a challenging but not overwhelming pace the aesthetic is fun and the world is engaging to explore my one complaint is that the story feels very unfulfilling at the end but i wasnt playing it for the story so thats not a detractor for me
great game for getting better at typing and learning new keyboard layouts
very pretty to look at fun and relaxed to play
fun game to work on your typing skills it also has some nice problem solving games as well
super cute little gem
beautifully crafted game right level of difficulty for someone who  can touch type but is not very fast
the typing words to battle system is lots of fun
beautiful paper art that constructs the landscape is the highlight of this fun typing adventure
amazing

really cool concept for a game and very deep and meaningful story behind it i loved the world design and how the world would reveal itself the more you unlocked it and the use of typing out your different powers is really cool too i loved how everything was made to look like is was all made out of paper like a story book i thought that was really unique and gave the game its own special charm to it plus the fox is cute
love the gameplay and the artstyle the powers are fun but spark seems a bit too strong to use anything else  will play nanotale
ending is very blah but im a sucker for a typing game
great for learning how to tpye
the story and ending was quite a surprise i thought this was just a wholesome game to get you to type faster it do the latter but former was a pleasant surprise

this is a beautiful narrative game that has the wonderful side effect of helping you type better and faster i started with my stats at 25 words and thought the goal of 40 was a reward i would never get now i am trying hard to get the achievement because it feels attainable it also accidentally helped with my spelling of certain words and expanded the words i knew the story is beautiful the artwork is amazing and the gameplay is unique and fun

this game is a cute way to practice your typing skills expect a good 46 hours of practice for completing the main campaign the strong point of this game is its visuals but i found the puzzles and battles challenging enough to stay engaging the whole way through the story unfortunately is where this game suffers it is cliched and i disliked the ending   overall i still recommend it but only if you know youre getting a typing program just as much as youre getting a game
i wanted a typingbased game to take my new keyboard for a spin but this is much more than just that so creative and super fun
the greatest typing improvement simulator

welcome to backoffice of a politiacal party world  cool game random and stupid words couldnt get used to walking but it was very original i liked it ending was pretty lame and there was a story which was very vague  710
good for typing practice but a bit buggy

this game is much better than i expected it has a great presentation good gameplay and is a lot more actionpacked than i expected the controls movement are a bit wonky but the game doesnt require high precision   the only downside is for completionists some achievements are too grindy and make the game more frustrating than challenging

i only have 15 hours in this game so far but its pretty cool and fun to try out your typing skills i type pretty quickly and so far i did run into trouble once during a long battle with some longer words i say as long as you watch for the quickest enemies and take them out first youll be ok i really think its cool to follow the story and utilizing your typing speed to kill baddies and progress the story cant wait to see more
i enjoy the art and mystery slowly evolving as well as getting a little better at typing accurately
best typing game ive ever played and it has a good story too
brill
i thought i was tough at typing until my right ring finger cramped at apologetic lol  ouch it still hurts
perfect training if youre working as a chat support agent
nice story game if you want typing challenge

and okayish typing game looking back i barely remember it but i do remember it being somewhat fun so if you are looking for a typing game which are rare i guess then this could be for you but dont expect anything amazing

fantastic typing game unlocked powers make the gameplay very interesting and properly challenging at times my only issue is that steam did not track my achievements properly but oh well  i truly came out a faster typist by the end

engaging gameplay cute artstyle wonderful soundtrack  enjoyable and simple story that has you exploring and revisiting areas with abilities you unlock along the way the combat keeps you on your toes and rewards those who change up their styles i very much enjoyed this short game and while simple at first glance allows for you to really work on your typing i dont think i realised how many mistakes i could make when under a little pressure

this game is a fantastic game for intermediate and higher typists who are looking to improve their typing skills it has has a few different keyboard layouts to choose from so you dont have to keep switching between the base keyboard layout qwerty for most american keyboards and whatever keyboard layout you have chosen to use in my case the devorak keyboard add in the beautiful storytelling and simple yet fantastic graphics youve got yourself a beautiful game
literally two of my favourite things in one game

fun typing game it looks nice and feels satisfying you cast spells to defeat enemies by typing words your spells are in different elements the last few boss fights on the bridge are very difficult with one i consistently manage to reach the what feels like the last wave of enemieswords but just cannot survive it because some words appear that i do not immediately recognise and worse are very long so if you want a fun typing challenge go for this game

really cool concept loved the artwork and the fact that i got to play around with my keyboard whereas most games focus on the mouse you have as the toy  also thought that the efji movement option was a neat little touch well thought out for sure

this game does provide a unique take on a typing game but unfortunately controlling the character and navigating around the playspaces is a huge friction point that made me stop playing after just a few hours  for a game focused on typing i found myself spending more time figuring out where to go and fighting the controls rather than actually typing

i would have given this game a great review yesterday but i just failed the same damn boss 10 god damn times  we all cant type at 100 wpm  i usually fall around 20 wpm and am playing to try to improve i cant keep up with a flood of enemies when half of them have 10 damn letter words   if i wanted brutal boss fights i would play dark souls

this is great

lovely game atmospheric and beautiful though i think the menus didnt match the aesthetic but they still functioned fine it was fun to explore the growing map and going through the story getting all the achievements got very tiring because of the sheer number of words you needed to type and the limitations of the default wordset but you can import different dictionaries for variety or just use the aaa dictionary

finished the game and i enjoyed it  story isnt anything too great but its frantic typing battles is a good test of any typists skills  not exactly a learn to type game but more of a test your skills game  overall great presentation good graphics and isnt too long  fun time
is okay

very fun and adaptive typing game if only there was a coding word practice mode per language and frame work or it could be open sourced so we can load our own practice words

this is a nice typingslashadventure game i am a poor typist so playing this game is a challenge especially when you have more than one type of spells and have to switch between them by typing their names it has some typing tutorial such as qwer uiop xm but dont rely on it to teach you like a proper lesson

i have now played 27 hours of the game and i love it it is a very fun way to relax and type the story is very engaging well told and cute the artworks are great the theme does function very well even though the graphics arent the best
pretty chill and enjoyable game i wasnt expecting to have that much fun from a typing game tbh

this game is criminally under rated the story is a bit on the weak side but the presentation and game play mechanics  are top notch and really encourage someone to try to get better at typing through fun engagement  the game can be casual enough to let young kids play while challenging enough to improve adults typing skills  my hope for this developer is that they make more fun typing games and even make a multiplayer traditional rpg with this same concept

fun typing game and a vibey kind of story really enjoy how the typing mechanic was incorporated and the puzzles are a little fun to just figure out sometimes annoying when words overlap and instead of attacking an enemy it switches the power or goes to a chest but overall not bad
great game if you can type fast
nothing like the click clack of that expensive keyboard you got
fun n exciting
i highly recommend players who enjoy exercising their fingers in typing and a fantastical gameplay that isnt too hard to follow its definitely one of my more favored games on steam so far
what a beautiful game to 100 a typing game has never impressed me this much and luckily this is an actual typing game and not one of those guess the word games loved it   completed in 10 hours
